units.title: Crypt isolation and organoid embedding
units.text: Crypt isolation was performed as previously reported45 with modifications. Briefly, tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidification, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol). The medium was changed every 3 days.
units.rationale: Describes the step‑by‑step procedure to isolate crypts and embed them for organoid culture.

units.title: Construction of LGR5‑mNeonGreen reporter
units.text: For the construction of a fluorescent reporter, an LGR5-mNeonGreen knock-in reporter was introduced into the last exon of LGR5 via electroporation, using previously published sgRNA (Sup- ...). Two LGR5-targeting sgRNAs were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids (a gift from Hui Yang lab), generating LGR5 sgRNA plasmids. HDR templates were made by replacing the CMV promoter in pBluescript II SK (+) (Addgene, #212205) with LGR5-P2AmNeonGreen sequence flanked by LGR5 homology arms using the Fast-Fusion™ Cloning Kit (GeneCopoeia). The LGR5 sgRNA plasmids and HDR template were co-electroporated into human intestinal organoids using a NEPA21 electroporator (Nepa Gene) following published methods45.
units.rationale: Provides the exact workflow for genome editing to create a fluorescent reporter line.

units.title: Organoid differentiation to specific lineages
units.text: Organoids were induced to differentiate by directly changing the culture media to differentiation media. The differentiation protocols are as follows: Paneth cells. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM), pVc (100 μg/mL) and IL-22 (2 ng/mL). Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days. Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) and CP673451 (0.5 μM) for 2 days, and then DMH1 (2 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), DAPT (10 μM), CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Gefitinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Lists the exact media components and timing for directed differentiation into four intestinal cell types.

units.title: EdU proliferation assay
units.text: For EdU cell proliferation assay Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour. Organoids were then collected, fixed, permeabilized, and EdU detection was performed according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
units.rationale: Specifies how to label proliferating cells with EdU and process the organoids for detection.

units.title: Immunostaining of organoids
units.text: Immunostaining organoids were released from BME with DPBS, fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde (Sangon Biotech) for 30 minutes at room temperature, and permeabilized in DPBS containing 0.5% Triton X-100. Samples were blocked and incubated in blocking buffer (0.1% BSA, 0.5% Tween 20 in DPBS) containing primary antibodies at 4 °C overnight. Primary antibodies used in this study were as follows: rabbit anti-Lysozyme (1:500, Invitrogen), mouse anti-Mucin 2 (1:100, Santa Cruz), mouse anti-α-defensin 5 (1:100, Santa Cruz), rabbit anti-OLFM4 (1:200, Cell Signaling Technology), rat anti-Somatostatin (1:200, Millipore), mouse anti-Glucagon (1:200, Santa Cruz), mouse anti-ALPI (1:50, Santa Cruz), mouse anti-GP2 (1:500, MBL), rabbit anti-E-cadherin (1:500, Proteintech). Samples were washed and incubated with secondary antibodies (1:1000, Invitrogen) for 1 hour at room temperature, counterstained with DAPI and imaged.
units.rationale: Details the fixation, permeabilization, blocking, antibody incubation, and imaging steps for immunofluorescence.

units.title: Single‑cell RNA‑seq library preparation
units.text: Single-cell RNA sequencing libraries were prepared using the 10x Genomics Chromium 3’ Gene Expression solution v3.1 following the manufacturer’s protocol and sequenced on a NovaSeq6000 (Illumina).
units.rationale: Provides the concise protocol for generating scRNA‑seq libraries from organoid cells.

units.title: Colony formation assay
units.text: Colony formation assay To assess colony-forming efficiency, organoids were dissociated into single cells and replated at a density of 8000 cells/well BME in 48-well plates. After 7 days, colonies were fixed, stained with DAPI, and counted manually. Colony-forming efficiency = number of colonies/number of plated cells × 100%.
units.rationale: Outlines the steps to evaluate the clonogenic potential of organoid cells.

units.title: Flow cytometry staining and analysis
units.text: Flow cytometry Cells were washed with ice-cold DPBS and filtered into FACS tubes through a 40 μm cell strainer. Cells were stained with Hoechst (Beyotime) to identify live cells before FACS analysis. FACS was performed on a BD FACSVerse (BD Biosciences), and data were analyzed in FlowJo (V10).
units.rationale: Describes the preparation, live‑cell staining, and analysis workflow for flow cytometry.

units.title: Organoid culture medium formulation
units.text: Organoid culture medium was prepared by mixing Advanced DMEM/F12 (Gibco) supplemented with B-27 (Gibco), 10 mM HEPES (Corning), 2 mM GlutaMAX (Gibco), Penicillin-Streptomycin (Gibco), and 1 mM N-Acetyl-L-cysteine (Sigma). For IL-hSIO culture, 50% Wnt3A conditioned medium, 10% R-spondin1 conditioned medium, 50 ng/mL EGF (Peprotech), 2 μM DMH1 (ApexBio), 10% R-spondin1 conditioned medium, 10 nM Gastrin I (MCE), 0.5 μM A83-01 (ApexBio), 4 μM CHIR (ApexBio), 20 nM TSA (ApexBio), 100 μg/mL pVc (Sigma) and 0.5 μM CP673451 (TargetMol).
units.rationale: Lists the basal and specialized supplements required for maintaining and differentiating organoids.
